newsitem.title: USA: Exxon mulls refining ventures - analysts.
newsitem.headline: Exxon mulls refining ventures - analysts.

text.p: Exxon Corp may consider joint ventures or alliances in the refining sector, chairman and chief executive Lee Raymond told analysts in New York.
No one from Exxon was immediately available for comment and its shares came off their lows during afternoon trade to close off 1/4 at $102-3/4 having been as low as 102 1/8 during the day.
Analysts said that Raymond indicated he was quite happy with the performance of Exxon's domestic refining operations, although he did note that the Baytown refinery was not matching expected returns.
"The comments on alliances or joint ventures were made in reference to refining as a whole, not to Baytown in particular," said an analyst.
Raymond also told analysts that he saw the annual increase in oil production rising from the current 1.5 percent to three percent.
"That is fairly significant given that Exxon is so conservative," said an analyst.
One analyst also noted that Raymond said he expected Exxon's debt ratio to continue to fall even allowing for dividends, divestments and capital expenditure.
"Somewhere along the line it looks as if the company is likely to do a share buyback or an acquisition," the analyst commented.
Raymond also emphasised Exxon's gas to liquid technology, which an analyst said could transform the economics of remote area gas production. ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
